pros: very nice people. Encourage you to work. some free time if enough work is done
cons: A lot to do Need to be able to lift and push heavy material

job_title: Full Time in New York, NY
pros: Colleagues really care about students, (especially faculty).
cons: Administration needs more direction. Lots of interims who are moving up the ladder, which doesn’t help with follow up on projects.

job_title: Assistant Director in New York, NY
cons: Night shifts are a little harder to manage

job_title: Adjunct Instructor in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: A lot of support from the Executive Team
cons: A lot to learn in short time.

job_title: Student Worker in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros:
-Relaxing environment
-Being able to do homework from other courses while at work
-Decent training process for new student workers
cons:
-Low Pay
-Can be busy sometimes and will have rude students despite themselves being adults
-Technologies such as computers and various applications can be buggy sometimes

job_title: Chemistry Instructor Post Secondary in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Strong union contract, adjunct faculty are on same contract, just pro-rated salary as long as they have five instructional credits. You can be as involved (or not involved) as you want.
cons: Predominantly white faculty, however there is a strategic direction to diversify the workforce.

job_title: Admissions Representative in Brooklyn Park, MN
cons: Slow moving change on some initiatives

job_title: Academic Advisor in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: I enjoy working at NHCC because I am treated with respect and kindness by my all of my colleagues in all departments. If I need help I know each person will come to my assistance. I am treated like the professional I know I am. Students know I care and give them my all and they often tell me that I made a difference in their time at NHCC.
cons: I wish we would give out semester awards to employees for their helpfulness, passion, and dependability because so many of us do a great job at this all the time and we should be told so from time to time.

job_title: Assistant Director, Facilities Management in Brooklyn Park, MN
cons: Absolutely awful management; Human Resources is completely incompetent and not there to help employees.  The employees Spend their entire day stabbing each other in the back...not to be outdone by the Human Resource staff who do it on a much higher level.  The facilities are miss-managed and massively understaffed.  Half the lights in the facilities don’t work, buildings are dirty, hiring friends and family has created cliques that team against each other.  State employees are generally poorly regarded for a reason but NHCC takes it to a whole new level.

pros: NHCC is a very student-focused community college. This is a very diverse campus and many of the students face personal struggles outside the classroom. However, most students are very motivated to do well and are truly interested in learning. Environment is supportive of faculty needs to help students learn. Overall, benefits package is good--better than most private industry.
cons: As with most higher ed, the pay is far lower than private industry. Some departments work well, but others are facing a lot of turmoil, which can make for a less than positive work environment. Overall lack of support for research.

review_title: PT Tutor - Inspiring Place to Work - Great People!!!
pros: I worked with Joe Crowe in the Tutoring department within the library while working toward my Associate's degree. An innovative and brainstorming kind of supervisor - fun to work with Joe!!  It was intrinsically motivating to help people understand Financial Accounting and Microsoft Office!! I really enjoyed the staff and most of the professors here - it was a great experience for me!
cons: None really - everyone at this school is so helpful and wants to see you succeed.

pros: Love working with a company product that I am inspired by:  educating learners!
cons: Lots of leadership transitions make it hard to work your pre-established plans.

job_title: Desktop Support Technician in Brooklyn Park, MN
pros: Good working environment. The staff are very welcoming and will do everything in their power to make you succeed.
cons: the position is not really challenging. The school need to do a good job at challenging employees
It would great if this school was a four year university
